result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Brian Glenn Bergum was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.dispoDesc: Defendant entered plea of NC.  Court finds defendant guilty and defers entry of judgment for 2 years.

supervisions.notes:
9 months county jail imposed/stayed - consecutive to any other sentence
Consecutive to: any other sentence

9 months county jail imposed/stayed consecutive to any other sentence: probation for a period of 2 years.  AODA and follow thru - no contact with Amy or Jake Checchin or Tim Matusek - any conditions DOC may impose - costs -

miscConds.notes: $443.00   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No contact with Amy Checchin or Jake Checchin and no contact with Tim Matusek.
OWI assessment within 72 hours and AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: Fine $473.50   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.
DNA surcharge $200.00   Pay obligation within 60 days or apply to the Clerk of Court for a payment plan within 60 days and pay the $15.00 payment plan fee.

30 days county jail consecutive to 15 CT 47 and count 2.
Consecutive to: 15 CT 47 and count 2

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Glenn Bergum

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian Glenn Bergum not in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State moved to dismiss as DE has complied with DGPA as to count 1.  Court  Count 1 is dismissed
Offender be discharged from probation effective date of this letter

Court addressed the defendant as to his right to have a preliminary exam.  Defendant does not wish to have a prelim.  Court finds defendant has freely waived his right to a preliminary exam and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant Brian Glenn Bergum in court with attorney Matthew C Lein.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CT 47 and 15 TR 4342
Atty Poquette recites plea - plead to all counts - (3) 30 days county jail and $673.50 with costs in 15 CF 205 - ct 2 9 mo jail stayed probation 2 years - AODA - no contact with Amy Checchin, Jake Checchin or Timothy Matusek - costs and count 1 DGPA for 2 years if successful will avoid the felony conviction / 15 CT 47 - plead to count 1 - count 2 DRI - 1 $1694.00 fine - 110 days county jail - 24 month revocation of DL - AODA with VIP - IID.  State victim rights does not apply in these cases.  Atty Lein and defendant agree.  Court questions defendant re: plea questionnaire.   Defendant entered plea of NC  to OWI in 15 CT 47 and counts 1,2 and 3 in 15 CF 205.  Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 in 15 CT 47 and counts 2, 3 in 15 CF 205 - Count 1 finds defendant guilty and defers entry of judgment for a period of 2 years / count 2 in 15 CT 47 is dismissed and read-in.  Also dismissed 15 TR 422.  State argues sentencing.  Atty Lein argues sentencing.  

COURT:
15 CF 205: ct 1  defers entry of judgment 2 years
ct. 2:   9 mo co. jail imposed/stayed - probation for a period of 2 years - AODA and follow thru - no contact with Amy and Jake Checchin or Tim Matusek - any conditions DOC may impose - costs - consecutive to any other sentence  

ct. 3: 30 days county jail consecutive to 15 CT 47 and count 2 - fine/costs $673.50 -  remanded to sheriff's department to begin sentence
Bail to be applied towards fines/forfeitures

Defendant Brian Glenn Bergum in court with attorney Matthew C Lein.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 15 CT 47 and 15 TR 422.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Lein makes stmt and waived time limits for preliminary exam.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:25 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brian Glenn Bergum in court with attorney Matthew C Lein.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, NG plea,  new Judge to be assigned for potential global resolution, requests preliminary hearing but waives time limits,
Defendent Brian Bergum, in court, in custody, appears by video.   Aaron Marcous appears for State.   SIBS $250, Absolute Sobriety.
